comments.body: PLEASE.
Why is it only the good ideas that dont get much votes?
I'm surprised that we've all just sorta gone with this for so long. In the tooltip, they're explicitly called oak trees as well, so it's not like there are two thoughts about it.

Birch Sapling (Ground) -> Birch Tree (Bee's)

Spruce/Pine Cone -> Spruce/Pine Sapling (after Ground) -> Spruce/Pine Tree (Spruce/Pine Cone)

Acacia Beans -> Acacia Sapling (after Ground) -> Acacia Tree (Acacia Flower, Bee's)

Acorns (Pigs) -> Oak Sapling (after Ground) -> Oak Tree (Truffles)

Dark Acorns (Pigs) -> Dark Oak Sapling (after Ground) -> Dark Oak Tree (Dark Truffles)

Apple (Horse) -> Apple Sapling (after Ground) -> Apple Tree (Apple)

Cocoa Beans -> Tropical Sapling (after Ground) -> Tropical Tree (Cocoa Fruit -> Cocoa Beans)

I love this idea, but where will the apple trees appear.
I think they can be generated in a flat village.

Separating those trees is a good idea, but the important stuff is not textures, but mechanics. Since we don't chop trees to get apples IRL, why should we in minecraft? Much more logical would be, that some of the leaves are "fertile", means when connected to the trunk and exposed to air, they grow apples. First, they become flowery, then grow apples. Process can be sped up by bees interacting with it. They however, when broken should drop regular apple leaves, so that you had to grow trees to get apples. Maybe all apple leaves could become flowery when bown-mealed? Someone in the comments here suggested these trees should spawn in villages. I agree. Saplings could be grown from apples on farmland.
It wood also help with more modern and futuristic designs!

They should definitely conside Iron or Stone ladders that don't need to be against a surface. Maybe even wooden ladders with vines on them that lets the wooden ladders be off of a wall and hang by the vines.
I have always wanted to have new ladders. The regular ladder doesn't always go with what I build, so it would be nice to have other options.

The iron ladder could maybe help you climb faster. If players like myself have a large hole they need to quickly climb out of, like a strip mine, they could use this as opposed to an expensive and complicated redstone elevator for example or the slower wooden ladders.

The biggest issue is the ladder not blending well with most materials, such as in the Ancient Cities, it stands out far to much from the deep slate. A ladder with sculk vines and deepslate bars could be nice, or an echo shard ladder that jingles or echoes out when climbed.
Purpur ladders for End cities
To add other ladder wood variants, is's need to change the ladder recipe. For example, to replace the central stick with planks.
I agree, it is also worth adding the ability to freely build the ladder up and down if one of the parts is fixed on a solid block.
The different woods would be great for making multifloor mazes with hard to find ladders as the blend better with the wall.
Not a bad idea but i like it

No es mala idea aunque sila pusieran tendria que poder ser tradeadas con los aldeanos granjeros y que se pueda se combinadas con el pastel para hacer un pastel de fresas y que con ellas se pueda alimentar a los conejos y que al ser una balla le gusten a los zorros y que nose emm.. por ejemplo que se pueda combinar con el oro para hacer fresas doradas y que al comerlas te den el efecto de saturacion porque actualmente no se puede obtener el efecto naturalmente

Maybe they could grow on bushes like sweet berries, but they would be found in oak and birch forests instead of taiga forests. They could grow in villages too. Maybe when crafting them with cake you could make a strawberry cake.

Actually I think what we should do is make it so you can add it to individual banner patterns. So, when you make the the banner the individual part of the banner is more visible in the dark while any patterns that did not get glow ink added to them would not be visible. You would just need to add it in while crafting the different banner patterns and then that pattern would glow, and if you wanted the whole banner to glow then just craft the entire banner together with glow ink, and any patterns you add after that without glow ink would not glow.
I second this !
Yess I really love this idea and it would add more uses to this lovely mob :)

Maybe when placing a glow ink sac where the banner patterns normal would be, it would make the pattern you choose, have the same glow as the signs in java. That way you could also have different colors. The patterns should of course also work, by crafting it with glow ink sac
neeeeeed this now!
I would love to see this It would bring some sense into having a diamond hoe and not just a wooden one. Love it.
I like it. Could also call it something like Reaping, or Scything.
on the new snapshots you can put looting on your hoe same with unbreaking
There should also be an enchantment called "Moisture" that has a chance of hoeing a dirt or grass block and it already being moisturized.

When I first though of hoes as having fortune I thought to myself “but that would probably be game breaking, which is why they haven’t added it yet,” but now I realize people make mega farms anyway and this could potentially be something to encourage breaking crops yourself and yielding just as much as a mega farm would.
Great idea
we have fortune
maybe the enchantment should be called "harvest"?
I feel like mechanical cars and bikes dont really fit into the minecraft theme, it certainly is a cool idea though!
IMO Minecraft shouldn’t have too much modern technology. I think horses as transportation is enough. I’m sure there’s multiple mods for this however.
Modern tech should definitely be a no go. Wagons, sail boats, that sort of stuff...sure. But cars, motorcycles, definitely not.
It's not apart of the theme and would destroy the point in horses and boats.
This has no place in minecraft :(

I think this is a great idea. Horses are slow and can die. You need tracks for minecarts. Boats are also very slow And can only hold two people. And pigs, well.............. So more vehicles would be awesome. Helicopters and planes could help you fly long distances. Cars and motorcycles would be good for cities and racetracks. And cruise ships, jet skis, and speedboats would be good for water travel.
• I really like that idea, it would be much easier to travel in far biomes. that can help many players too
Yes, except maybe just use coal
great udea i want vehicles!
they should be super expensive to craft and fuel though
No.
Great! I could build giant stadiums and have green seating!
I want wool stairs and slabs, because of at the moment I use quartz, and that is not comfortable. so I want wall stairs and slabs!
Or even just terracotta and wool would be appreciated!

Glowstone stairs would look a bit odd. It’s the same reason there’s no glass stairs. I think sticking mostly to stone-like blocks makes sense. However, since Copper will be getting stairs and slabs, it’s only fair that all the other ores get the same treatment.
I'd love to see Amethyst Slabs and Stairs! It would be so musical!
For me, lapis lazuli stairs and slabs would be interesting. That would be very nice.

Maybe.  All keys should look the same, but can be named with an item tag.  They would be crafted with two gold nuggets.

Padlocks would be only found locked on chests in dungeons and temples.  They would be uncraftable, and only obtainable through dungeons and temples, found on chests and not in them.  They should be breakable with any type of pickaxe.  When placed on a chest/door, a place to type a name would pop up (similar to a sign).  Once a padlock is named, it would take a key with that name to unlock it.  A padlock would be visible on the door/chest.

The door/chest could only be opened while holding the key with the right name.

Bad idea:  They could be placed on shulkers, preventing them from opening and shooting.  The key would allow them to shoot, or prevent them from shooting if they are already unlocked and closed.
But... If you can break them with only a pickaxe, what would be the use of them? Maybe it is only possible with an iron pickaxe
this is already a feature but it would be nice to do it without cheats :3
What I mean by having them breakable with an pickaxe is that there must be some way to remove them from whatever they’re on.
Love it!
How about making it to where you can only mine it with a diamond pick when placed down again.
Maybe there's an actual unique key item, that can lock doors and trapdoors as well as containers.
APRIL FOOLS we had them

Exactly! I feel like nether quartz has two key uses- architecture and redstone contraptions. However, architecture must use it in block form, and redstone machinery needs it in ore form. I find that it's very inconvenient to not be able to store the quartz in block form, since it can't be converted back. 

Additionally, it's considered an ore, and every other ore in the game (coal, iron, redstone, gold, emeralds, lapis, and diamonds) can be stored as blocks then converted back into ore form.
I thought that this feature was already in the game, and so I turned all of my quartz into blocks. Now that I need regular nether quartz, I can’t use any of it because it’s all in block form.
I would support this even if you only got one quartz per block of quartz.

Mojang seems to not like doing storage blocks for some reason. Even recently with 1.15, the honeycomb blocks are able to be made with 4 honeycombs but isn't able to be turned back into 4 honeycombs even though in real life you could rip apart a honeycomb into smaller pieces with your bare hands. Maybe because quartz and honeycomb blocks only take 4 items to make? But then you have the Nether Wart Block which takes 9 items to make and still isn't able to be turned back into items, even though it's a farmable item just like wheat, and Hay Bales can be turned back into wheat but Nether Wart Blocks can't be turned back into Nether Warts. It makes no sense. You'd think all farmable items that can be turned into blocks would be able to act as storage blocks. Nope. You'd think Nether Quartz, the second most abundent ore in the game, would be able to be turned into a storage block, especially since every single other ore can. Nope. There's no consistency. The thing is, it wouldn't even be that hard to implement either, an amateur mod maker could add it in under an hour. Why do they not do it then? No idea.

Ugh, I'd love for this to be added in. I was just about to go and make some stuff using quartz but I just so happened to craft all of my quartz into 32 blocks of quartz earlier, making them all useless to me at the moment...
yes use redstone users would love this as SOME of use like to make massive farms using observers. not everyone has access to shulkers you know

In one of my big mods, I added onyx, an end equivalent of quartz, it can be crafted back to onyx on a stone cutter and the same applies to quartz. It also works with various redstone and the cobbles can be replaced with any stone from vanilla, and my mod and even other mods.
There are so many items that can be bundled and unblundled yet quartz remains out of that club and it has already ruined a few playthroughts to me

So much about Minecraft is pretty intuitive or makes sense once you din out--BUT NOT THIS! Every other ore can switch back and forth, even if there's some cost to it. Not allowing quartz to do this, even if one block turns to 4 nether quartz instead of nine, is very STUPID and FRUSTRATING. We shouldn't have to look it up after we've converted stacks of nether quartz and completely SCREWED ourselves. I'm not usually a swearer, but I would load this comment with expletives if I could. I needed that nether quartz for a project and now my partner feels bad because he converted it all to blocks thinking we could store it that way. You have made my partner feel sorry for something that's not his fault and I kinda hate you for it!

Also, I'm out of nether quartz.

ANGRY!!!!

This would help so much with quartz storage, especially since getting quartz with Fortune III is a pretty fast inventory filler.

Also I feel that there really is no excuse with the addition of the copper block; a block that not only acts as a storage block but also as a building block.
Well given that we can already craft various types of stew, I see no reason to argue that we shouldn't be able to craft a Bacon-Lettuce-Tomato sandwich either.
Yes, I was posting an idea about this, they should give you 5 hunger bar (steak) since steak give you 4, this should be added to bedrock and Java!
What about a ham sandwich with cheese and lettuce?
I think that sandwiches should be like an advanced cake. You can eat it 3 or 4 times, it gives you 2 hunger points and has a little health bar to see how many times you can eat it.
With my post about cheese, it, combined with bread and meat could make a sandwich, restoring definitely more than 10 health points, it needs a lot of it. I do agree.
most definitely combining breat with meat. This should be added.
Yes to crafting sandwiches, and perhaps "chips" (potato crafting and cook)! Thank you!
Oyuna sandiviç gelsin
I think that instead of each plank having it own design I think that a block or item put next to it in the 3x3 grid and 2x2.
Make them have the same recipe of the chiseled stone brick and chiseled quartz block and each one have their own texture. That'd be great!
Sounds awesome, think of some ideas for the palm wood and baobab wood!

Cool idea - use the same recipes for decorative stone blocks, but for wood. Could I suggest some alternatives:

  • Oak - apple relief
  • Spruce - pine cone
  • Jungle - vine fretwork
  • Birch - heart carving (I like the creeper face, but that's already on chiseled sandstone)
  • Dark Oak - Square wooden paneling.
  • Acacia - eagle/bird
  • (Palm - tiki mask)
  • (Baobab - villager)

I also like the idea that when blocks that have the same carving are placed side-to-side they would 'join' so that the edges would blend to form a larger "carving" (similar to paths)
If this is added I think there should be a crafting block (a variant of the stonecutter) which also makes crafting wood stairs and slabs easier. (Maybe a lumberjack villager to go with it)
What about the new Nether Planks?
This could be made in a woodcutter.
It might be more balanced to make it carved stripped logs/wood, which would put it pretty much on par with carved stone
What about nether stems and mangrove? (Oh wait this is 6 updates behind)

I'd say make it so that Obsidian Arrows can't be magic tipped. 

This would ensure that regular arrows are still needed, and it would eliminate the need to add an obsidian arrow for EVERY potion effect.

 

Great idea though.
Yes! This is a good step to make minecraft:obsidian more like the reallife obsidian. Totally for it!
I just want obsidian arrows, period. Make obsidian chips on the anvil.
That’s a great idea and then we would get a new mob also!
Obsidian arrowheads were actually used in real life so this makes total sense
Why would you break it with an antler??
Could the antler - since it can break obsidian - break stone?? I'm voting

Obsidian arrows makes sense because obsidian is very sharp and was used in real combat. As a downside, they shatter upon landing, making them a single use item. This encourages players to have better aim and might be good for balancing. It's also more realistic, as obsidian in real life is quite easy to shatter.

Someone else said something about using just an anvil which I think would work significantly better and make it easier to accomplish. And also probably more realistic than an antler. This could also lead into why we might need a hammer, which when added in an anvil with obsidian would create the shards. Hammers could also be affective to make reinforcements on a tool, iron pickaxe with hammer in an anvil would create a reinforced iron pickaxe. Which could give it more durability.

And I also believe when using obsidian arrows, you should be able to use it more than once, 1 arrow can last 2-4 times and will be dropped when a mob is killed.

Love this idea and it’s exactly why I came on here, so I could post this idea.
Another great way to give the Fletching Table purpose in-game.

A lot of farms use the existing speed of minecarts. So perhaps to prevent this change breaking farms Mojang should introduce a new rail named “amythyst rails” Thus giving a use for amythyst in Minecraft.
I agree... they kinda slow tbh. I feel like ppl could be more productive in building, sending items, and getting around their worlds!
canman 18 better see this
They should be totally faster

They should be faster, but just reverting its speed changes other uses for it and can cause some other problems. But having both options, the normal minecarts and a new Copper minecart, that can go even faster.

I would like apple trees to be more like bamboo, because I feel like Minecraft has enough trees, hehe :D So, an apple tree doesn't get taller than two bloks and when mined you would just get sticks. When fully grow you can pick apples from the tree, like sweet berries from the sweet berry bush. Though, I really like the idea with golden apple trees or enchanted golden apple trees. It sounds so cool.
I really like that idea. It would be cool if you could also make apple juice.
I would like to see this in Minecraft. If any developers see this please put this idea under review. I would love to see this added in a future update.
It would be really cool to have an addition to farming

My idea for apple trees is similar to grass seeds becoming wheat, via oak trees.

Functionally, they're similar to azalea trees being that they have oak wood but a different type of leaf block that drops apples if destroyed instead of oak saplings.

This could set up a precedent for how fruit trees would work, adding new fruit and leaf-block types without having to add a new wood type(with the exception of cheery trees as they're famously known for their wood). Furthermore, fruit trees for the most part should not have a tall/big version to differentiate them from their wild non-fruit counterparts, considering how historically, fruit domestication favors shorter trees because they're easier to pick and ensures both tree types have separate specialized roles for fruit and wood.
There should definitely be apple trees, since it is ridiculous that apples come from oak trees. That makes no sense!

I agree apple trees should be a thing sure you get them from oaks but it's a certain drop chance and 9/10 don't always get one, having them harvestable like the sweet Berries in tree form would be great add a new food item with it as well like apple pie like pumpkin it would be redish in center and berry pies would be cool too and have more a purplish color in center over all apple trees and more food items would be cool. Pies, maybe jams/jellys combined with the bread loaf make jelly/jam sandwiches
I think it would be a better idea if apples were rare and you had to find them to plant your own apple tree, since golden apples are a valuable resource
Also, rusted Iron cannot be mined without silk-touch, for realism. Also, the first two stages can be abolished via the brush, but the final stage requires lightning to set it right.
I think exposing it to a water source would be enough

It would be cool if we had other materials that would oxidize as well, tbh. Unfortunately the only metals available are Iron (discussed here), Copper (already oxidizes), Gold (doesn't oxidize easily, iirc), and Netherite (fictional, and thus technically irrelevant). Gems don't oxidize, though certain kinds of stone might weather over time... Regular stone/cobble → mossy stone/cobble, anyone? Or perhaps an actual "weathered" variant that operates separately from the mossy? And what about mossy weathered/weathered mossy variants?

yes, we need this you can't just have copper rusting and not iron.
but I  think just making it cosmetic like copper would be the best.
Great idea! What about if rusted iron bars give you the wither effect when stepped on? (after a few days, and the wither effect lasts for in-game weeks)
Like the idea, they could make it work just like copper with 4 stages and wax to stop the process.
And also, Iron Golem to rust and not work like copper golem when oxidised.
I would really like to see rusted blocks in game I and i'm sure many other people could do so much with a block like that.

I would love iron that gets more and more corroded over time. We have copper that goes from orange to aquamarine. I would love a grey block like iron to have more of a texture change in addition to color. Deep red corrosion could help with all sorts of cool builds and create more ruined and industrial builds

I also think iron golem and armor should rust. I think they should rust regardless as their durability goes down, but they rust faster in contact with rain or water. Also, I think there should be a way to craft iron that doesn't rust, probably using amethyst to make it more useful
No, rusting is for copper only!

Maybe the rust cannot be scraped once it becomes at least weathered, however rusting faster can be done with wet sponges.

These are examples of iron rusting:

I’m very interested in storing enchanted books in bookshelf blocks.

The idea of books on shelves having any sort of effect on enchanting items doesn’t really interest me as much as just being able to put enchanted books onto bookshelves.

I think bookshelves should have their own inventory specifically for enchanted books. It would save space of needing to have chests around to store books. And since you would have 15 bookshelves around an enchanting table I think it would be ideal.
Plus signed books and book and quil
Good idea!
But what about writen books and quils?
I think it would be great if each bookshelf had an inventory the size of a hopper that could store enchanted books, book and quills, regular books, and signed book and quills.
I reposted this because the other one was deleted after I edited it.

I was also thinking of this! They should be found in mountains in the wild, as they lack vegetation. Since the devs are updating the mountains, I think adding strawberries would work well as a new plant!

TERIBLE? these texture are amazing especially the strawberry can i use the strawberry texture for my mod? plssss ill credit you

and while i wait i will put this in my mod if tell me if you do not agree i will take it down
Can't argue too much with that, it also makes managing large stores of inventory much easier on the player.
Yep It would be better and this will contrast with trapdoors door etc.
Yep It would be better and this will contrast with trapdoors door etc.
I also think it's a necessity now, we have so much variant of every blocks, but chest are still the same since the beginning of the game.

This is a no brainer.

Of course this should be a thing. With so many variants of fence, stairs, slabs, etc -- why not have chests with different colors?
This should include the new nether "wood" too!
Having the same Chest color in different biomes makes it look very bland, it would be better if we had more variants of the Chest!
No reason this isn’t in the game already
We NEED more chest variants! Wood chests look so out of place in Nether and End structures, and in ancient underground ones!
I wish they would add it because it's just decoration and that's it. Jappa is very good at that.

This would be good for identification. Your Dark Oak chest for valuables, Birch for your Building Materials, Mangrove for Redstone, Pale for Equipment- There's a lot of promise here. The fact that boats have variants should make this viable. Perhaps chorus fruit could be given more use and crafted into a purple wood...

(This message originates from a different post)
Yes please!  And variant barrels too!

Because not everything needs or should have a block form?

If they are a thing, gunpowder blocks should have unique properties rather than simply existing to compact gunpowder.
No. Gunpowder is a POWDER. Which means it would instantly crumble if put into block form.
TheFriendlyPine, you know sand is also an equally unstable fine particulate right?
:/ yes but with that, it’s SANDSTONE which has been compressed down from sand for a very long time, with gunpowder, you just can’t replicate that.
Ok, TheFriendlyPine, I see there's still a misunderstanding. Sand, which also exists within minecraft on it's own despite also being small individual particles, is allowed to be a block.
Yeah I thought about that after I wrote it lol.

Because it to play more better ,and to make gun battle

Asdff5
ummmmmmmm. ok

Technically, if you would compress gun powder, it would be explode.

Want you something like that in Minecraft?

I don't need a exploding crafting table!
I think mojang should make compressed gun powder and then make it automatically explode when it comes in contact with fire and the blast being bigger than tnt.
make it really flammable so it can be a fuse
It should explode when fired or when something exploded near

addressing a concern, sand is also a powder of sorts

this would be cool but

with a catch

this block would not explode when lit but instead be incendiary, it will fizz alot and light the more flammable stuff on fire like hay blocks or wool

besides that this does not seem to work out in any other way
So, a great way to break the redstone contraptions of the people you wanted to visit since some redstone machines are finicky and if you activate the lines out of order they will break.
That's why in maps or complex contraptions a sign says "Stand Here"

Sorry mate, but this is just not a good idea at all. In addition to all the practical problems ClayGoddessSari mentioned, it sounds really hard to code. You'd have to change the game to where all redstone components would have to be constantly checking for a player wearing redstone armor within a certain radius. Even if that's possible to code in, which it probably isn't, it likely would have severe negative effects on our computers' performances.

It also demonstrates a very elementary knowledge of how redstone works on your part, I think. Many redstone circuits depend on having some parts powered at some times and other parts unpowered at other times. This idea would help no-one.

So your purpose is to have a very special way of activating redstone without touching anything.  The only issue is everything that isn't very specially designed to work with it and doesn't happen to be extremely robust by nature is just going to break the moment you walk close...

Your purpose sounds pretty cool, honestly.  The issue is it would also be adored by griefers who would just walk around the base of someone who loves redstone contraptions and wreck them all.
Awesome!! This would be a great mod, but it has a few flaws
this would break redstone machines so much. but, a fun idea too.
redstone dust wouldn't work, maybe using 2 redstone dust can make an item used for redstone armor?

This is a bad idea for armour.

But as an enchantment, it'd be a really good idea
The only use I can think of for this is to set off traps. Why would anyone wear a trap trigger?
I LOVE THE IDEA😂😃😃😃CAN YOU ADD IT
INTO VINELLA MINECRAFT?
Redstone armour could be a good idea but instead of a redstone signal special boosts like night vision for the helmet
can it provide 1 light too??????
Son
Rafts should be flat 4×4 peices of palm tree wood since we are eventually getting palm trees. Plus the raft should be mountable by one person but several people can hitch a ride by standing on it.
you predicted the future

This is possible now via bamboo rafts.

This idea is now:
The is a good suggestion. I think adding to the number of blocks hoes can break is good. Also sponges being as useful as they are would be useful to have an effective tool to break it.
I would love this.
hoes should also break vines and kelp, and kelp blocks, and leaves faster!!!
Hoes should also be able to break leaves faster and get more sapling and sticks seeing as their is no way to effectively get saplings without destroying a whole forest
Well if the wither makes the roses, and the roses are pure evil, logic states it SHOULD be placable on nylium!
Maybe not on naked netherack, but on nylium is a great idea!!
I'm surprised this isn't already a feature! I'm sure it's sensible enough for them to already be considering it.

Dyed, floating leaves would also add an interesting option for visual effects. 

Glass is dyable and transparent, and you've all seen some of the crazy visual effects that can be achieved by layering glass. Imagine being able to do something similar, but with more opaque colors and with texture!

Are you proposing that leaves be dyeable by the player via crafting (i.e., pink dye + leaf block = pink leaf block), or are you simply proposing that colors of leaves change with the seasons? If the latter, then I love the idea, but unfortunately it has been brought up in other posts before. If the former, then... I wouldn't be convinced that it would be a good idea (green dyed leaf blocks??).

Also, how would you address the concerns of a player who wants a green leaf block as decoration all year round?

I prefer new trees in new biomes with different seasonal leaves to leaves that change color based on the seasons.  Especially since there aren't seasons in Minecraft...

The nice thing about a new spring biome and a new fall biome is the player could take these new season based trees and plant them anywhere.
@ClayGoddessSari Yes, that's also very much a viable alternative
If they look stupid, don’t build them.  Enough said.
Yes. please, this would be great, it would open so many possibilities for themed building and forests, imagine a meadow surrounded with cherry blossoms and a single sakura in the middle

I'd love to see more wood types. It would defiitely improve many builds. However, since Minecraft is global, some features should be thought out carefully to prevent certain people groups from pissing off. Have a look at this video, and you'll understand what I mean. Even though cherry blossom trees don't have a known origin, the connotation associated to the country, especially the one with colonial history, may make some people feal a bit bitter. Keep your comic book and video scene recreations personal.

I had posted a similar suggestion and it must have been deleted by the staff here.

I suggested being able to dye already sheared leaves. It makes it easier on the game devs because it is basically adding a skin to a block. This could be done in the crafting table and would allow the use of all the colors. :)

Yes please, I've been trying to make a cherry tree in my world as a memorial for a friend. But the wool ones look so fake. If I would dye leaves then I would make an actual tree.

Alternative solution could be to add a cherry tree type to the game. Including cherries as a food type pickup.
This would be a great addition to the game! I'm sick of having to use the various pink colored blocks in the game to make a cobbled-together mess of a tree, with textures all over the place.
Actual cherry leaves can be used now.

No currently existing dispenser function remains functioning as long as it stays powered, its a block that works on pulses. It could be made so spears are the exception, but I think it would be better if it aligned and was instant use, stab out then retreat. If you want constant damage, you can attach it to a redstone clock
Best suggestion i’ve seen in a few years
I love it
I think stabbing out then back in would work better like the other guy, but awesome idea, Mojang needs to add this
If Mojang ever decided to update the Jungle Temple structure, then this idea has great potential to compliment it.
